result.execSummary:
The defendant Ian David Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***

Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.
If Defendant is released today must report to Probation by 4:00 p.m.

  

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF469.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF469.

-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.
-Court permits random UA testing at the discretion of the Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with the Asteria Inn and Victim E.S.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Count 2

superMiscConds.notes:
-Court will adopt the recommendations of the Agent in the Revocation Summary for Extended Supervision.
-Mental Health Evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Ian David Nelson appeared from jail. Case called at 9:07 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a sentencing on revocation. ADA Minser gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Andrea gives sentencing argument. Requesting court follow recommendation of probation agent. DE makes statement. 20 days to appeal. 

Court orders:

Impose a bifurcated sentence. TOTAL 3 years. IC: 1 1/2 years, ES: 1 1/2  years.  
- 160 days credit
- Court will adopt the recommendations of the probation agent in the revocation summary summary for extended supervision conditions
- DE is eligible for for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program
-   AODA and follow any recommended treatment.
-   Mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment
-   Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections
Atty. A. Andrea. gme
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 1, 2016 at 08:45 am.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Ian David Nelson appeared from jail. Case called at 11:10 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a sentencing hearing on revocation. Atty Andrea makes statement. Requesting a new court date prior to 12-01-2016. ADA Minser does not object to a continuance.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for December 1, 2016 at 08:45 am.
filed by Agent Otradovec. gme

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Megan Kelly  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Ian David Nelson appeared from jail. Probation agent Terry Otradovec present. Case called at 9:33 a.m. Court reviews file. Letter from the probation agent requesting 50 days of conditional jail time. Both parties have a copy of the letter. Atty Andrea spoke to probation agent and all parties stipulate to 50 days jail to 30 days jail. ADA Kelly in agreement. 

Court orders:

-   30 days conditional jail time
filed by Agent Terry Otradovec requesting Defendant sit conditional time. eif

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Sarah Slice Yacoub   DF:  Ian David Nelson appeared from jail. Case called at 10:57 a.m. Case was scheduled for a PTC. There is an agreement. Atty Yacoub recites agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO CONTEST to amended Ct's 1 & 2 in 15CF469 without the repeater enhancer. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct's 1 and 2 in 15CF469 without the repeater enhancer. Sentencing arguments. State has complied with Victims Rights. 20 days to appeal Crt orders:

On Count 1:

-    S/W 2 years probation consecutive to Ct. 2. Bond will continue until reports to probation. If released today, must report by 4:00 p.m. today. 

-   AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

-    Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

-   Crt permits random UA testing at the discretion of the Probation Agent.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.a third person.  

- Court costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge

-- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Asteria Inn and Victim E.S. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  


On Count 2:

- Impose 90 days jail. 75 days credit. TIME SERVED
Filed by ADA Minser. km
filed by ADA Edward Minser. eif
Pre-trial conference at 12-17-2015 10:45 am

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Sarah Slice Yacoub   DF:  Ian David Nelson appeared from jail. Case called at 9:27 a.m. State has filed an information with the court. Court informs Def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant has received a copy of the information. NG on all charges. Atty Yacoub requesting a new court date so she may comply with the states discovery request.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 10:45 am.
Arraignment at 10-21-2015 09:00 am

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Sarah Slice Yacoub   DF:  Ian David Nelson appeared from jail. Case called at 10:07 a.m. ADA McKinley calls Officer Crubaugh to the stand. S/T Officer Crubaugh employed with New Richmond PD. Direct by ADA McKinley. Witness identifies defendant in the courtroom. Cross by Atty Yacoub. Witness excused. Argument by Atty Yacoub. State gives argument. Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Atty Yacoub
15SW194 executed on 10/5/15; signed by SRN on 10/5/15 with Application and Affidavit.
Preliminary hearing at 10-14-2015 10:00 am

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Asteria Inn & Suites.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: RMW, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton,  DF:  Ian David Nelson appeared from jail. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Prelim requested. ADA Nieskes requests $2500.00 CB, Atty Caton argues. Defendant is on a PO hold. Request speedy prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
